ground_truth: As Red and Homer return fire, Baby Face shoots at a townsman who holds a pistol at his side. Dillinger crawls to the dead gangster, looks sadly at Tommy, then turns his attention back to the fight. As Baby Face raises his gun to fire again, a guy jumps on his back, and Baby Face tosses him into a window. Dillinger joins the others, firing at the second story window across the street, with dust billowing around it as bullets hit the exterior stone wall. Red glances over his shoulder as Dillinger reloads his gun and fires it at a man hiding behind a car. He hurries to Baby Face and drags him, who continues to shoot. With its door still open, the car pulls out of the town square, leaving the hostages lying helplessly in the street. The car speeds down an empty road lined with tall evergreens that jut into the pale blue sky. Golden sunlight shines on its sleek exterior, reflecting the snow-covered ground bordering the woods. Dillinger sits in the backseat, the wind from the open windows blowing against his disheveled hair. In the front passenger seat, Homer stares distantly. Behind him, Dillinger drinks from a flask as Red administers an injection into his shoulder wound. Nighttime comes, and the car's headlights glow eerily through the trees as it makes its way through the dark woods. The night casts a turquoise hue over Dillinger, who clutches his shoulder in the backseat. The car slows as it approaches a lodge where light shines warmly through the windows. As Baby Face pulls the car to a halt, Dillinger addresses him with a frown. The four gangsters enter the lodge. Upstairs, Baby Face bundles cash while Red preps a dressing and Homer looks on. Red unrolls a bandage and dresses Dillinger's wound. Homer grabs his take as Baby Face picks up two cash bundles and tosses one to Shouse. As they both clear out of the room, Homer hangs back in the doorway, looks to Dillinger, who gives a nod, and Homer leaves. Red remains seated at Dillinger's side. As Red wipes his hands, Dillinger springs restlessly to his feet, and the two men share a solemn look. Dillinger holds out Red's share. Red accepts the cash, gives his brow a resigned lift, and shoots a tentative smile at Dillinger. He stows the cash in his bag and leaves. Now in a medical exam room, the gangster with the eye wound pleads with two G-men. Purvis halts a doctor and courteously gestures for the doctor to step away. The interrogator pushes on the man's wound while Purvis stands with his back to the torture session. The gangster spits at his tormentor, and the stern-faced G-man turns gravely towards Purvis and nods.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: As Crimson and Homer return blaze, Baby Face fires at a villager who grips a revolver at his flank. Dillinger creeps to the lifeless mobster, gazes sorrowfully at Tommy, then directs his focus back to the skirmish. As Baby Face lifts his firearm to blaze anew, a fellow leaps on his shoulders, and Baby Face hurls him into a pane. Dillinger joins the remainder, shooting at the second-story pane opposite the avenue, with particles swirling around it as projectiles strike the outer stone barrier. Crimson peeks over his shoulder as Dillinger reloads his firearm and discharges it at a fellow concealing behind an automobile. He rushes to Baby Face and pulls him, who persists to blaze. With its portal still ajar, the vehicle departs from the town plaza, leaving the captives lying powerlessly in the avenue. The vehicle hastens down an unoccupied route fringed with tall firs that extend into the pale azure sky. Gilded sunlight gleams on its polished surface, reflecting the snow-clad terrain bordering the forest. Dillinger resides in the backseat, the breeze from the open panes blowing against his tousled hair. In the front passenger position, Homer gazes distantly. Behind him, Dillinger sips from a container as Crimson administers an injection into his shoulder injury. Nightfall arrives, and the vehicle's lamps illuminate spookily through the trees as it drives through the shadowy forest. The night casts a turquoise tint over Dillinger, who grips his shoulder in the backseat. The vehicle decelerates as it nears a chalet where illumination radiates warmly through the panes. As Baby Face draws the vehicle to a stop, Dillinger addresses him with a scowl. The four mobsters enter the chalet. Upstairs, Baby Face bundles currency while Crimson preps a dressing and Homer observes. Crimson unrolls a bandage and dresses Dillinger's injury. Homer snatches his share as Baby Face picks up two currency bundles and tosses one to Shouse. As they both vacate the chamber, Homer lingers in the threshold, glances at Dillinger, who gives a nod, and Homer departs. Crimson remains seated at Dillinger's side. As Crimson cleans his hands, Dillinger springs restlessly to his feet, and the two fellows share a grave look. Dillinger extends Crimson's portion. Crimson accepts the currency, gives his brow a resigned lift, and offers a hesitant grin at Dillinger. He tucks the currency in his bag and departs. Now in a medical exam chamber, the mobster with the eye injury begs with two G-men. Purvis halts a physician and courteously gestures for the physician to step aside. The inquisitor presses on the fellow's injury while Purvis stands with his back to the torment session. The mobster spits at his tormentor, and the stern-faced G-man turns gravely towards Purvis and nods.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: As fire is returned by Red and Homer, a townsman who holds a pistol at his side is shot at by Baby Face. The dead gangster is crawled to by Dillinger, who looks sadly at Tommy, then turns his attention back to the fight. As his gun is raised to fire again by Baby Face, his back is jumped on by a guy, and the guy is tossed into a window by Baby Face. Dillinger joins the others, firing at the second story window across the street, as dust billows around it and bullets hit the exterior stone wall. Over his shoulder, a glance is thrown by Red as Dillinger's gun is reloaded and fired at a man hiding behind a car by him. He hurries to Baby Face and drags him, with shots continuing to be fired by Baby Face. With its door still open, the town square is exited by the car, leaving the hostages helplessly lying in the street. Down an empty road lined with tall evergreens that jut into the pale blue sky, the car speeds. Its sleek exterior is shone on by golden sunlight, reflecting the snow-covered ground bordering the woods. In the backseat sits Dillinger, with the wind from the open windows blowing against his disheveled hair. In the front passenger seat, a distant stare is held by Homer. From a flask, Dillinger drinks behind him as an injection is administered into his shoulder wound by Red. Nighttime comes, and through the trees, the car's headlights glow eerily as the car makes its way through the woods. Over Dillinger, a turquoise hue is cast by the night, and in the backseat, he clutches his shoulder. The car is slowed as it approaches a lodge where light shines warmly through the windows. The car is pulled to a halt by Baby Face, while with a frown, he is addressed by Dillinger. The lodge is entered by the four gangsters. Upstairs, cash is bundled by Baby Face while Red prepares a dressing as Homer looks on. A bandage is unrolled by Red, and Dillinger's wound is dressed by him. Homer's take is grabbed, and two cash bundles are picked up by Baby Face, who tosses one to Shouse. As they both clear out of the room, the doorway is hung back in by Homer, who looks to Dillinger, and is given a nod, then leaves Homer. At Dillinger's side, Red remains seated. As his hands are wiped by Red, Dillinger springs restlessly to his feet, and a solemn look is shared by the two men. Red's share is held out by Dillinger. The cash is accepted by Red, who gives his brow a resigned lift, and a tentative smile is shot at Dillinger. The cash is stowed in his bag, and he leaves. Now in a medical exam room, pleas are made by the gangster with the eye wound to two G-men. A doctor is halted by Purvis, who courteously gestures for the doctor to step away. The man's wound is pushed on by the interrogator while with his back to the torture session, Purvis stands. At his tormentor, the gangster spits, and gravely, the stern-faced G-man turns towards Purvis and nods.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: As Red and Homer exchange fire, Baby Face shoots a townsman with a pistol. Dillinger crawls to the deceased gangster, mourns Tommy, then resumes fighting. Baby Face raises his gun but is tackled, throwing the attacker into a window. Dillinger joins in, firing at a second-story window, dust billowing as bullets strike stone. Red watches Dillinger reloads and shoots at a man behind a car, then rushes to drag Baby Face away as he continues firing. The car leaves the square, hostages abandoned, speeding down a road lined with evergreens under a pale sky. Sunlight reflects off its sleek exterior and the snowy ground. Dillinger, wind tousling his hair, sits in the back as Homer stares distantly in front. Dillinger drinks from a flask as Red injects his shoulder wound. At night, the car's headlights shine through the woods, bathing Dillinger in turquoise light. It slows near a warmly lit lodge. Stopping, Dillinger frowns at Baby Face. Inside, Baby Face bundles cash, Red prepares bandages, and Homer watches. Red dresses Dillinger's wound. Baby Face tosses a cash bundle to Shouse, and both leave; Homer lingers, nodding at Dillinger, then exits. Red stays by Dillinger, who stands solemnly. Dillinger offers Red's share, he accepts it with a resigned smile, stores it, and departs. In a medical exam room, a gangster with an eye wound pleads with G-men. Purvis signals a doctor to step aside as an interrogator presses the wound. The defiant gangster spits, and a stern G-man gravely nods at Purvis.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: As Red and Homer return fire, Baby Face shoots a pistol-holding townsman. Dillinger crawls to a dead gangster, looks sadly at Tommy, then resumes fighting. Baby Face is attacked but throws the assailant into a window. Dillinger and others fire at a second-story window, bullets hitting the stone wall. Red glances as Dillinger reloads and fires at a man hiding behind a car. He drags Baby Face while shooting. The car leaves the town square, hostages left in the street. It speeds down a road lined with evergreens under a pale blue sky. Golden sunlight reflects off its sleek exterior, contrasting with snow-covered grounds. Dillinger sits in the back, wind blowing his hair, while front-seat Homer stares distantly. Dillinger drinks from a flask as Red injects his shoulder. At night, headlights illuminate the dark woods. Dillinger clutches his shoulder, the car slowing at a lodge with warm window lights. Baby Face parks, Dillinger frowning. The gang enters. Upstairs, Baby Face counts cash, Red preps a dressing, and Homer watches. Red bandages Dillinger. Homer and Baby Face collect their shares, Shouse gets a bundle, and Homer nods at Dillinger before leaving. Red stays with Dillinger, accepts his share with a resigned look, and leaves smiling. In a medical exam room, a gangster pleads with two G-men. Purvis halts a doctor, gestures him away. An interrogator presses the gangster's wound, and he spits. The stern G-man nods gravely to Purvis.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As Red and Homer begin to return fire, Baby Face, with steely determination, takes aim and shoots at a townsman who has a pistol hanging casually at his side. Meanwhile, Dillinger crawls determinedly over to the lifeless body of a fallen gangster, gazing sorrowfully at Tommy's motionless form before redirecting his focus to the escalating fight. Just as Baby Face readies himself to fire yet again, a man courageously leaps onto his back, prompting Baby Face to hurl him forcefully through a nearby window. Dillinger then joins the fray with the others, directing a hail of bullets toward the second-story window across the street, where a thick cloud of dust swirls around the impact points as ammunition strikes the stone wall. Red throws a quick glance over his shoulder, seeing Dillinger reloading his weapon and then taking aim at a man concealed behind a car. Dillinger promptly makes his way to Baby Face, dragging him along as he continues to shoot. The car, with its door still open wide, pulls away from the chaotic town square, leaving the hostages sprawled helplessly on the street. The vehicle accelerates swiftly down an empty stretch of road bordered by towering evergreens that stretch into the expansive pale blue sky above. The golden sunlight bathes the car's sleek exterior, casting a bright reflection on the snow-covered ground that edges the dense woods. Inside the car, Dillinger sits in the backseat, the brisk wind from the open windows tousling his already disheveled hair. In the front passenger seat, Homer gazes distantly into space, lost in thought. Behind him, in the rear, Dillinger takes a drink from a flask as Red administers a careful injection into Dillinger's shoulder wound. As nighttime descends, the car's headlights illuminate the trees with an eerie glow as it carefully navigates the dark woods. The night envelops Dillinger in a turquoise hue as he clutches his shoulder in the backseat. Gradually, the car slows its pace as it nears a lodge, where light pours warmly through the inviting windows. Baby Face expertly brings the vehicle to a halt, and Dillinger, with a frown, addresses him. The four gangsters proceed to enter the lodge together. Upstairs, Baby Face busily bundles stacks of cash while Red diligently prepares a dressing with Homer watching intently. Red methodically unrolls a bandage and carefully attends to Dillinger's wound. Homer takes hold of his share as Baby Face lifts two bundles of cash, tossing one casually to Shouse. As Shouse departs from the room, Homer lingers for a moment in the doorway, looking back at Dillinger, who gives him a nod of approval, prompting Homer to leave. Red stays seated loyally at Dillinger's side. As Red meticulously wipes his hands, Dillinger suddenly rises to his feet, restless, and the two men exchange a solemn look of understanding. Dillinger offers Red his share of the loot. Red accepts the cash, lifting his brow in a gesture of resignation, and then flashes a tentative smile at Dillinger. He carefully stows the cash in his bag and makes his way out. Meanwhile, in a stark medical exam room, a gangster with a grievous eye wound pleads desperately with two G-men. Purvis, standing to the side, courteously gestures for the doctor to step away from the interrogation. The interrogator, showing no mercy, presses forcefully on the man's wound, while Purvis remains with his back to the harsh proceedings. The gangster defiantly spits at his tormentor, and the stern-faced G-man turns gravely to look at Purvis, nodding in acknowledgment.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: As Red and Homer begin to return fire with precise and focused intent, Baby Face, filled with steely determination and unwavering resolve, takes careful aim and shoots at a townsman who has a pistol hanging casually and carelessly at his side. Meanwhile, Dillinger crawls with persistent determination over to the lifeless body of a fallen gangster, gazing sorrowfully and with deep regret at Tommy's motionless form before redirecting his focus to the fast-escalating and chaotic fight. Just as Baby Face readies himself to fire yet again, a man, with commendable bravery, courageously leaps onto his back, prompting Baby Face to hurl him forcefully and with great strength through a nearby window. Dillinger then joins the fray with the others, directing a relentless hail of bullets toward the second-story window across the street, where a thick cloud of dust swirls and dances around the impact points as ammunition strikes the sturdy stone wall. Red throws a quick, furtive glance over his shoulder, seeing Dillinger reloading his weapon with methodical efficiency and then taking aim at a man concealed behind a car. Dillinger promptly makes his way to Baby Face, dragging him along as he continues to shoot with unwavering determination. The car, with its door still open wide in haste, pulls away from the chaotic and tumultuous town square, leaving the hostages sprawled and lying helplessly on the street. The vehicle accelerates swiftly down an empty, deserted stretch of road bordered by towering, imposing evergreens that stretch majestically into the expansive pale blue sky above. The golden sunlight bathes the car's sleek exterior, casting a bright, shining reflection on the snow-covered ground that edges the dense, mysterious woods. Inside the car, Dillinger sits in the backseat, the brisk wind from the open windows tousling his already disheveled and windswept hair. In the front passenger seat, Homer gazes distantly into space, lost in his own thoughts and musings. Behind him, in the rear, Dillinger takes a drink from a flask as Red administers a careful, practiced injection into Dillinger's shoulder wound. As nighttime descends, the car's headlights illuminate the trees with an eerie, ghostly glow as it carefully navigates the dark, foreboding woods. The night envelops Dillinger in a turquoise hue as he clutches his shoulder in the backseat, a testament to the day's events. Gradually, the car slows its pace as it nears a lodge, where warm, inviting light pours warmly through the inviting windows. Baby Face, with expert skill, brings the vehicle to a halt, and Dillinger, with a frown, addresses him. The four gangsters proceed to enter the lodge together as one. Upstairs, Baby Face busily bundles stacks of cash while Red diligently prepares a dressing with Homer watching intently and closely. Red methodically unrolls a bandage and carefully attends to Dillinger's wound with great care. Homer takes hold of his share as Baby Face lifts two bundles of cash, tossing one casually to Shouse. As Shouse departs from the room with a casual air, Homer lingers for a moment in the doorway, looking back at Dillinger, who gives him a nod of approval, prompting Homer to leave. Red stays seated loyally at Dillinger's side, a silent but steadfast companion. As Red meticulously wipes his hands clean, Dillinger suddenly rises to his feet, restless and full of energy, and the two men exchange a solemn look of understanding. Dillinger offers Red his share of the loot with a gesture of camaraderie. Red accepts the cash, lifting his brow in a gesture of resignation, and then flashes a tentative smile at Dillinger, a moment of shared respect. He carefully stows the cash in his bag and makes his way out of the room. Meanwhile, in a stark and sterile medical exam room, a gangster with a grievous and severe eye wound pleads desperately and with urgency with two G-men. Purvis, standing to the side, courteously gestures for the doctor to step away from the tense interrogation. The interrogator, showing no mercy, presses forcefully on the man's wound, while Purvis remains with his back turned to the harsh proceedings. The gangster defiantly spits at his relentless tormentor, and the stern-faced G-man turns gravely to look at Purvis, nodding in acknowledgment of the situation.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As Red and Homer quickly return fire amid the chaos, Baby Face spots a townsman with a pistol casually hanging at his side and takes aim, firing a shot in his direction. Meanwhile, Dillinger cautiously crawls over to a fallen gangster, Tommy, taking a moment to gaze sadly at his lifeless form before redirecting his focus back to the ongoing gunfight. As Baby Face lifts his gun to fire once more, he is suddenly tackled from behind by a determined man, whom Baby Face effortlessly throws against a nearby window, shattering the glass. Dillinger joins his fellow gangsters in firing at a second-story window across the street, where bullets incessantly strike the stone wall, causing dust to billow outward. Red, in a moment of vigilance, glances over his shoulder just as Dillinger methodically reloads his weapon and takes aim at a figure stealthily concealed behind a car. Acting swiftly, Dillinger rushes toward Baby Face, dragging him while Baby Face continues to discharge his weapon. Even as the car with its door ajar accelerates swiftly out of the town square, the hostages are left incapacitated and scattered on the ground. The car navigates an empty road flanked by imposing evergreens that stretch towards the pale blue sky. The exterior of the car gleams under the golden sunlight, casting reflections on the snow-dusted landscape adjacent to the woods. Inside the car, Dillinger sits in the backseat, his hair tousled by the wind rushing through the open windows. Homer occupies the front passenger seat, gazing pensively into the distance. Behind Homer, Dillinger takes a swig from a flask while Red tends to Dillinger's shoulder wound with an injection. Nightfall descends, and as the car ventures deeper into the darkened woods, its headlights carve eerie patterns through the trees. A turquoise hue envelops Dillinger while he sits clutching his shoulder in subdued discomfort. The car decelerates as they near a lodge, a welcoming light spilling warmly from its windows. Baby Face deftly brings the car to a stop, prompting Dillinger to address him disapprovingly with a frown. The four gangsters make their way into the lodge, and upstairs, Baby Face efficiently gathers bundles of cash while Red meticulously prepares a dressing for Dillinger's wound, with Homer observing silently. Red unrolls a bandage with precise care and dresses Dillinger's wound, his movements practiced. Afterward, Homer collects his share of the loot as Baby Face picks up two bundles of cash, casually tossing one to Shouse. Homer hesitates briefly at the doorway, exchanging a knowing glance with Dillinger, who offers a subtle nod, prompting Homer to exit. Red remains seated beside Dillinger, both immersed in a moment of shared understanding before Dillinger rises abruptly, a restless energy about him. They exchange a solemn glance as Dillinger extends Red's share, which Red accepts with a resigned arch of his brow, managing a tentative smile. He carefully places the cash in his bag and departs. In a stark shift of scene, a gangster with an eye wound finds himself pleading with two G-men in a medical exam room. Purvis arrives, stopping a doctor with a polite gesture, indicating for the doctor to step aside. Simultaneously, the interrogator presses persistently on the man's wound as Purvis stoically turns away from the scene. In defiance, the wounded gangster spits at his tormentor, leading the stern G-man to turn gravely toward Purvis and offer a solemn nod of acknowledgment.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: As Red and Homer return fire, Baby Face targets and shoots at a townsman. Dillinger crawls to the fallen gangster, momentarily mourns Tommy, and then refocuses on the ongoing gunfight. When Baby Face is attacked by a man jumping on his back, he quickly throws him into a window. Dillinger joins the others in firing at the second-story window, dust billowing as bullets hit the stone exterior. After Red glances back, Dillinger reloads and fires at a man hiding behind a car. He swiftly moves to Baby Face and drags him as he continues shooting. As the car leaves the town square with its door open, hostages are left helpless in the street, and it speeds down an empty road lined with towering evergreens under the pale blue sky. Golden sunlight reflects off the car's sleek body and the snow-covered ground by the woods. Dillinger sits in the backseat, wind tousling his hair, while Homer stares distantly from the front passenger seat. Dillinger drinks from a flask as Red tends to his shoulder wound with an injection. Night falls, and the car's headlights cut through the dark woods. Under the turquoise glow of night, Dillinger clutches his shoulder while the car approaches a warmly lit lodge. After Baby Face parks the car, Dillinger frowns at him, and the gangsters enter the lodge. Upstairs, Baby Face bundles cash as Red prepares to dress Dillinger's wound, with Homer observing. Red bandages Dillinger, while Baby Face shares cash with Shouse. As Homer takes his share and leaves, he exchanges a nod with Dillinger. Red stays with Dillinger, and after a solemn look, Dillinger gives Red his share. Red accepts the cash, shows a resigned smile, and leaves. Meanwhile, in a medical exam room, a gangster with an eye wound pleads with two G-men. Purvis halts a doctor, gesturing politely for him to step away. The interrogator presses on the man's wound while Purvis stands turned away from the torture session. The gangster spits at his tormentor, prompting the stern-faced G-man to gravely nod at Purvis.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: As Red and Homer return fire, Baby Face, who was known for his youthful appearance despite his notoriety, shoots at a townsman who holds a pistol at his side. Dillinger, infamous for his bank robberies during the Great Depression, crawls to the dead gangster, looks sadly at Tommy, one of their gang members, then turns his attention back to the fight. As Baby Face raises his gun to fire again, a guy jumps on his back, and Baby Face, displaying his infamous ruthlessness, tosses him into a window. Dillinger joins the others, firing at the second story window across the street, with dust billowing around it as bullets hit the exterior stone wall of the historic building known for its architecture. Red glances over his shoulder as Dillinger reloads his gun and fires it at a man hiding behind a car. He hurries to Baby Face and drags him, who continues to shoot. With its door still open, the getaway car pulls out of the town square, leaving the hostages lying helplessly in the street. The car speeds down an empty road lined with tall evergreens, a common sight in the northern states, that jut into the pale blue sky. Golden sunlight shines on its sleek exterior, reflecting the snow-covered ground bordering the woods known for their serene beauty. Dillinger sits in the backseat, the wind from the open windows blowing against his disheveled hair, reminiscent of his high-speed escapes. In the front passenger seat, Homer stares distantly, perhaps contemplating the future of their criminal enterprise. Behind him, Dillinger drinks from a flask, a common practice among outlaws of the era, as Red administers an injection into his shoulder wound. Nighttime comes, and the car's headlights glow eerily through the trees as it makes its way through the dark woods often feared for harboring danger. The night casts a turquoise hue over Dillinger, who clutches his shoulder in the backseat. The car slows as it approaches a lodge, a remote hideout, where light shines warmly through the windows. As Baby Face pulls the car to a halt, Dillinger addresses him with a frown, perhaps reflecting on their precarious situation. The four gangsters enter the lodge. Upstairs, Baby Face bundles stolen cash while Red preps a dressing and Homer looks on. Red unrolls a bandage and dresses Dillinger's wound, showcasing their reliance on each other for survival. Homer grabs his take as Baby Face picks up two cash bundles and tosses one to Shouse, indicating a division of their ill-gotten gains. As they both clear out of the room, Homer hangs back in the doorway, looks to Dillinger, who gives a nod, a silent signal of trust and understanding, and Homer leaves. Red remains seated at Dillinger's side. As Red wipes his hands, Dillinger springs restlessly to his feet, and the two men share a solemn look, possibly acknowledging the uncertainty of their path. Dillinger holds out Red's share. Red accepts the cash, gives his brow a resigned lift, and shoots a tentative smile at Dillinger. He stows the cash in his bag and leaves, knowing the life of an outlaw is fraught with danger. Now in a medical exam room, the gangster with the eye wound pleads with two G-men, federal agents tasked with dismantling organized crime. Purvis, known as the man who took down Dillinger, halts a doctor and courteously gestures for the doctor to step away. The interrogator pushes on the man's wound while Purvis stands with his back to the torture session, perhaps reflecting his complex role in the justice system. The gangster spits at his tormentor, and the stern-faced G-man turns gravely towards Purvis and nods, indicating the gravity of their mission to end the gangster era.

Dillinger crawls to the dead. gangster looks sadly at Tommy then turns his attention back to the fight. As Baby Face raises his gun to fire again a guy jumps on his back and Baby Face tosses him into a window. Dillinger joins the others firing at the second story window across the street with dust billowing around it as bullets hit the exterior stone wall. Red glances over his shoulder as Dillinger reloads his gun and fires it at a man hiding behind a car. He hurries to Baby Face and drags him who continues to shoot. Dillinger sits in the backseat. the wind from the open windows blowing against his disheveled hair. In the front passenger seat Homer stares distantly Behind him. Dillinger drinks from a flask as Red administers an injection into his shoulder wound. Nighttime comes and the car's headlights glow eerily through the trees as it makes its way through the dark woods. The night casts a turquoise hue over Dillinger who clutches his shoulder in the backseat. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. The car slows as it approaches a lodge where light shines warmly through the windows. As Baby Face pulls the car to a halt Dillinger addresses him with a frown. The four gangsters enter the lodge. Upstairs Baby Face bundles cash while Red preps a dressing and Homer looks on. Red unrolls a bandage and dresses Dillinger's wound. Homer grabs his take as Baby Face picks up two cash bundles and tosses one to Shouse. As they both clear out of the room Homer hangs back in the doorway looks to Dillinger who gives a nod and Homer leaves. Red remains seated at Dillinger's side. As Red wipes his hands Dillinger springs restlessly to his feet and the two men share a solemn look. Dillinger holds out Red's share. Red accepts the cash gives his brow a resigned lift and shoots a tentative smile at Dillinger. He stows the cash in his bag and leaves. Now in a medical exam room. the gangster with the eye wound pleads with two Gmen. Purvis halts a doctor and courteously gestures for the doctor to step away. The interrogator pushes on the man's wound while Purvis stands with his back to the torture session. The gangster spits at his tormentor and the sternfaced Gman turns gravely towards Purvis and nods.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: As Red and Homer return fire Baby Face shoots at a townsman who holds a pistol at his side. Dillinger crawls to the dead. gangster looks sadly at Tommy then turns his attention back to the fight. As Baby Face raises his gun to fire again a guy jumps on his back and Baby Face tosses him into a window. Dillinger joins the others firing at the second story window across the street with dust billowing around it as bullets hit the exterior stone wall. Red glances over his shoulder as Dillinger reloads his gun and fires it at a man hiding behind a car. He hurries to Baby Face and drags him who continues to shoot. With its door still open the car pulls out of the town square leaving the hostages lying helplessly in the street. The car speeds down an empty road lined with tall evergreens that jut into the pale blue sky. Golden sunlight shines on its sleek exterior reflecting the snowcovered ground bordering the woods. Dillinger sits in the backseat. the wind from the open windows blowing against his disheveled hair. In the front passenger seat Homer stares distantly Behind him. Dillinger drinks from a flask as Red administers an injection into his shoulder wound. Nighttime comes and the car's headlights glow eerily through the trees as it makes its way through the dark woods. The night casts a turquoise hue over Dillinger who clutches his shoulder in the backseat. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. The car slows as it approaches a lodge where light shines warmly through the windows. As Baby Face pulls the car to a halt Dillinger addresses him with a frown. The four gangsters enter the lodge. Upstairs Baby Face bundles cash while Red preps a dressing and Homer looks on. Red unrolls a bandage and dresses Dillinger's wound. Homer grabs his take as Baby Face picks up two cash bundles and tosses one to Shouse. As they both clear out of the room Homer hangs back in the doorway looks to Dillinger who gives a nod and Homer leaves. Red remains seated at Dillinger's side. As Red wipes his hands Dillinger springs restlessly to his feet and the two men share a solemn look. Dillinger holds out Red's share. Red accepts the cash gives his brow a resigned lift and shoots a tentative smile at Dillinger. He stows the cash in his bag and leaves. Now in a medical exam room. the gangster with the eye wound pleads with two Gmen. Purvis halts a doctor and courteously gestures for the doctor to step away. The interrogator pushes on the man's wound while Purvis stands with his back to the torture session. The gangster spits at his tormentor and the sternfaced Gman turns gravely towards Purvis and nods.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: As Violet and Jasper toss water, Little Chief waves at a merchant who grips a book at his feet. Lancer slithers to the fallen pirate, glances cheerfully at Timmy, then shifts his gaze back to the skirmish. As Little Chief lifts his broom to wave again, a bird lands on his head, and Little Chief flings it into a tree. Lancer joins the creatures, throwing paint at the third floor box across the yard, with smoke swirling around it as colors splash the wooden gate. Violet peers at her elbow as Lancer refills his paintbrush and splashes it at a child hiding behind a horse. She hops to Little Chief and pulls him, who continues to wave. With its hatch still ajar, the horse gallops out of the village center, leaving the butterflies flying effortlessly in the yard. The horse trots down a crowded lane bordered by short sunflowers that lean into the bright orange sky. Silver raindrops fall on its rough surface, reflecting the mud-covered path bordering the garden. Lancer lounges in the basket, the breeze from the open flaps ruffling his tangled fur. In the rear luggage space, Jasper gazes anxiously. Near him, Lancer sips from a goblet as Violet administers a massage into his ankle blister. Dawn arrives, and the horse's twinkling eyes blink calmly through the roses as it navigates through the bright meadow. The sunrise casts a golden glow over Lancer, who strokes his ankle in the basket. The horse halts as it reaches a hut where shadows flicker warmly through the curtains. As Little Chief pushes the horse to a stop, Lancer greets him with a laugh. The four magicians enter the hut. Downstairs, Little Chief arranges books while Violet concocts a potion and Jasper observes silently. Violet tears a paper and applies it to Lancer's blister. Jasper grabs his loaf as Little Chief selects two book stacks and hands one to Shelby. As they both rush out of the cellar, Jasper lingers by the threshold, turns to Lancer, who offers a wink, and Jasper exits. Violet stays perched at Lancer's side. As Violet cleans her brushes, Lancer stands excitedly on his legs, and the pair exchange a thoughtful glance. Lancer offers Violet's loaf. Violet grabs the book, gives her chin a hopeful tilt, and beams a wide grin at Lancer. She wraps the book in her coat and exits. Now in a bakery, the magician with the toe blister begs two animals. Carson pauses a baker and kindly signals for the baker to stay nearby. The examiner rubs the man's blister while Carson sits with his face to the healing session. The magician sneezes at his healer, and the smiling animal turns joyfully towards Carson and nods.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: In a tense standoff, Red and Homer exchange gunfire, while Baby Face takes out a townsman with a pistol. Dillinger mourns a fallen comrade but soon re-engages in the shootout. Baby Face is ambushed but quickly overpowers his attacker. Dillinger and Baby Face, with Red's aid, retreat in their car, leaving hostages behind. As they speed down a tranquil road flanked by evergreens, Dillinger tends to his wounds with Red's help. Night falls, and their car approaches a lodge warmly lit from within. Once inside, the gangsters divide their loot. Red bandages Dillinger's shoulder, and Baby Face distributes cash. As the others leave, Red and Dillinger share a somber moment before parting. Meanwhile, a wounded gangster is interrogated by G-men. Purvis halts a doctor's involvement but allows the coercive questioning to continue. The gangster resists, provoking a grim acknowledgment from a G-man.
